title: Why did i not get any champion mastery shards?? Is it broken?
body: I have rank 5 on both {{champion:17}}  and {{champion:115}}, so i should be able to get champion mastery shards on them. Yet, even though i got an s- on {{champion:115}} for 1 game and an s+ for  {{champion:17}} in another game, i didn't get any mastery shards for for either of them despite getting the s- and the s+. I don't think its the game-mode, i am playing the Poro King, because it says that everything is suppose to be available, just like summoners rift and aram,  so i am just confused why i didn't get them. I am just wondering if anyone else has had the same issues come up.

replies.body: Hey, it looks like you've already received mastery chests for Ziggs and Teemo.  Mastery chests are available only once per champion per season, more info in our [hextech crafting](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207884233-Hextech-Crafting-Guide) .  You can get more for those champs once it resets sometime in the next season.

>I don't think its the game-mode, i am playing the Poro King, because it says that everything is suppose to be available, just like summoners rift and aram

It *is* the game mode. Champ Mastery tokens are only available from classic Summoner's Rift games. You can't even earn them in ARAM or ranked Treeline. It's counter-intuitive, illogical, and only mentioned in the [support article](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/204211284), but that's unfortunately how it is unless enough people bug Riot to change things.
